newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX ACCESS oil prices ease after surging on Iraq - Sept 3.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX ACCESS oil prices ease after surging on Iraq - Sept 3.

text.p: U.S. energy futures prices softened in early ACCESS trade Tuesday, as traders began selling off contracts they had scrambled to buy Monday after the U.N. said it suspended Iraq's oil-for-food agreement.
"The quietness is because people are profit-taking a little bit and saying this is not the proper level for crude," one trader said.
October NYMEX crude traded $23.35 a barrel on ACCESS, off five cents from the close with 500 lots trading early.
October gasoline lost 0.11 cent to reach 62.85 cents a gallon on ACCESS on a very light four lots traded.
October heating oil dropped 0.17 cent a gallon to trade at 64.90 cents on 40 lots exchanged.
